Text.Page: Tamur came to you with a problem. Kaia, heartbroken by the tremendous number of casualties, decided to risk her life in a bold strike on the argons in the Khanovar Gauntlet. Tamur begged you to intercede, pointing out that Kaia could be killed, which would shatter troop morale. Kaia refused to change her mind, but agreed to take you and Hasmina into battle. You fought heroically, but the sheer number of argons overwhelmed even Kaia's strength. Kaia reluctantly retreated, much to Tamur's relief.
Report to {@Creature:248#2001$$Tamur} at Khanovar Citadel for priority redeployment.
Thank...thank you for avenging my father. My duties required me to put my vengeance on hold. <NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Your father understood duty."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

True enough.

We've another crisis at the moment, though. {@Creature:248#2010$$Kaia} insists on taking the field in an attempt to end this war.

You of all people know the gods can die as easily as any mortal. We can't lose Kaia. It would shatter morale!

Do me a favor-try to talk her out of it.

Don't try to stop me, . For too long, we guardian gods have watched the events of the world, yet done nothing.

I know the risks, but that doesn't obviate my duty to our soldiers."At least let me fight by your side!"

Very well. If it silences Tamur's objections, join me. With you and {@Creature:248#2011$$Hasmina} at my side, none can stand against us!

We'll leave when you're prepared.

I can hear the song of battle-a sound I've not heard in far too long.

We'll show the argons the power of our courage!

Take heart, my friend. You, Hasmina, and {@Creature:248#2010$$Kaia} stood up to our foesâ€”and survived. That example will inspire our troops for years to come.

I'm sending you and Hasmina to Kanstria. She's waiting outside to brief you.
